If using oAuth, your app's consumer key. Must be used with auth.secretKey
If using shared secrets, your shared secret
textBeforeTable: Parameters: Returns a list of posts, authors, section topics or tags depending on specified type. Docs: analytics/{type} <static> byType(type, opts, auth, cb) → {object} analytics.js , lineno 3 Source: API npm install cd node-parsely git clone https://github.com/toddself/node-parsely  Development  });   console.log(data);   }     console.log(err);   if(err){ parsely.analytics.byType('query', 'posts', {days: 1
textAfterTable: days string <optional> Number of days since today to consider for _hits value. Defaults to 3. period_start mixed <optional> Period of data to cover. Must supply opts.period_end as well period_end mixed <optional> Period of data to cover, cannot be in the future. Must use opts.period_start as well. pub_date_state mixed <optional> Start date of content publication to consider. Must use opts.pub_date_end as well. pub_date_end mixed <optional> End date of content publication to consider. Must use opts.pub_date_start as well. sort string <optional> Sort value. Defaults to _hits limit string <optional> Number of records to retrieve, detauls to 10 page string <optional> Page number of results set, defaults to 1 auth object <optional> Authorization information. If not using, pass in null or undefined Properties Name Type Argument Description secretKey string <optional> If using oAuth your app's secret. Must be used with auth.consumerKey consumerKey string <optional> If using oAuth, your app's consumer key. Must be used with auth.secretKey sharedSecret string
